website_summaries.verdict: Shoppers on a budget seeking an affordable food steamer with consistent results should look closely at this one. It's a great value.
pros: Includes two transparent steaming bowls which are also double-tiered
cons: Not the largest product on the market
without anything placed inside, some may find it heavy for the size

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS FOR BABY FOOD!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to steam vegetables to purée baby food for my kid. I open up the instructions and a paper falls out that reads "this product contains a chemical known to the state of California to cause birth defects or other reproductive harm." After searching online I learned that there's bpa in this, which it's effects would be seen in babies and the heat would further aggravate. I'm so annoyed because this should've been clear in the description online instead of wasting my time. I don't feel comfortable prepping my child's food in something that could cause issues for them. Seriously just steer clear
customer_reviews.author: Mariam

customer_reviews.title: works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this steamer for about 3months now, and I love it. I steam everything which is a much healthier way of cooking. It works perfectly. I haven't figured how to get tasty fish steamed as yet, but in time I will because I love fish also. So far I have steamed broccoli, sweet potatoes, white potatoes, carrots, corn, squash, pumpkin, string beans, ochra, etc and they have been very delicous and fully cooked. Great steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Finey.I

customer_reviews.title: Not awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike this steamer. I Gave it as a gift and they gave it back! That's how bad it is. Don't put seafood on the bottom (like the picture) it will make anything you put in the top taste like fish. So strange. Works well for other things, though. Shipping etc was prompt.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: It's the worst one I've had in 30 years
customer_reviews.text: This veggie steamer is mediocre. The plastic containers are so thin I was afraid they wouldn't make it through the dish washer. The base collects residue around the edges and must be cleaned by wiping it inside and out with paper towels each time it's used. The water container is small, holding only two cups of water so it may run out before the veggies are done. The whole system takes about 5 minutes to start putting out steam which increases the cooking time each time used. It's the worst one I've had in 30 years. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Harold

customer_reviews.title: Appears Larger Online
customer_reviews.text: It's much smaller than it appears to look online. I have one that's 29 years old and still use it regularly. This one appears to have gone the way of too many other things today. Smaller and cheaper. Maybe it will last. Who knows?
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but just ok
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest thing ever. The plastic bowls are thin and creaky and seem pretty fragile, not sure how well they will hold up. Also this thing is hard to store because the bowls don't really nest together, they get stuck together and then you have to hope they don't crack when you try to separate them. It steams fine, a bit on the slow side, however. Takes awhile. I wouldn't buy it again but your experience may vary.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good steamer for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This steamer works very well. Especially for the low price. You can use either one or two tiers. The instructions are very good including times for steaming many different things. The only thing I wasn't crazy about is I feel like I have to be careful when washing the steamer bowls. They're not really that thin but I still feel the need to use caution when washing by hand. Overall I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: puttputt

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly awesome!!! I love it. By the time I come home from working out and put my food in the oyster!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily Blonski

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made won’t buy again. Bought it to replace 15 year old Singer steamer
customer_reviews.author: Philip McCulloch Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Not like the older model
customer_reviews.text: I've used a similar Oster model for 10 plus years at least three times a week. The plastic part that holds the veggies is very strong. It's been dropped numerous times and it never broke. I only replaced it because the heating element wore out. This new models plastic is paper thin. I can almost break it while putting in the veggies. I'm very disappointed and am switching brands.
customer_reviews.author: CES

customer_reviews.title: This Steamer is Great With One Caveat
customer_reviews.text: We get almost daily use of this steamer. The two tier design is clever and has come in handy. My only complaint (and a big enough one to deduct a star off an otherwise 5 star product) is how flimsy and fragile the steaming baskets feel. I feel like I could break one with a minimum of effort. I hope I never drop one, because it might just crack or break. Other than that, it works great, is easy to clean (use the top rack on the dishwasher for those baskets, the bottom one will obliterate them), and doesn’t take up a ton of space while using it on the counter. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Currans

customer_reviews.title: good steamer with slightly small bowls.
customer_reviews.text: we love steamed vegetables, corn on the cob and asparagus are our favorites. we have used the same electric steamer for over 15 years and it has been great but the bowl finally cracked . we bought this one to replace it because it had double Decker bowls so we could steam more than one veg at a time. the only downside from what we had is this steamer's bowls are only 7.5 inches diameter vs. the old one at 8.5 diameter. this means trimming more off the vegetables or cutting them in half, not a major thing but not optimum.
customer_reviews.author: DMann

customer_reviews.title: Works But Is Messy
customer_reviews.text: It cooks well. However, the design is a disaster. Use this only for vegetables if you don't want a major mess. Any meat or fish and you will be left with a terrible greasy stew at the base which is obviously difficult to clean without use of soap water and running water. Always afraid I will get water into the machine and will lead to its malfunction over time. I really hope they can figure out a way to not have the grease from food just dump into the reservoir. I find myself these days avoiding using this thing just because of how annoying it is to clean.
customer_reviews.author: David Weis

customer_reviews.title: Burn hazard. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: No proper handle therefore you’re opening the lid by lifting the little lips on the side (see pics) These lips, however, when lifted forces the residual heat to escape directly towards that open space. This results in super hot steam hitting your finger tips immediately. IF there was a proper handle to lift the lid from the middle-up, this problem won’t exist since the heat disperses evenly all around and your fingers aren’t in direct way. Both husband and I burned our fingers already. WILL BE RETURNING IMMEDIATELY.
customer_reviews.author: APMK

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasey!
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer. It allows me to steam a few veggies or a lot of veggies with the tray you can add on top. This is my second Oster food steamer as I wore my other one out. I have never steamed anything but vegetables in it but the photo shows meat on the bottom tray. The trays are easy to clean and the bottom part where the water is kept to make the steam is easy to clean too. The dial allows you to choose the time you want to steam your veggies or food for.
customer_reviews.author: JetNoise

customer_reviews.title: Boils into lower basket.
customer_reviews.text: It works ok but it boils up into the bottom of the lower steam bin. Also does not have a drip pan, so the steam from meats drips back into water bin. Want to return it but cost $14.00 to return and only paid $25. Guess I’ll keep it, works ok with potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: K4gwb

customer_reviews.title: Greet fot steaming salmon & shrimp. Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to used & the instruction was correct, i used it almost everyday to steam salmon & vegies & it has work perfectly. One thing about this product it should have been a little bigger like 50% bigger so i can steam a lot for a couple of people but to the steaming fish & shrimp its very exellent. Thanks for having this available through amazon.
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this review to make steaming for baby purée easier and it was! Being able to do two veggies at once saved me time! The plastic containers are easy to clean but I will say after a couple uses and even with cleaning it the bottom part that holds the water is getting gross. I’ve scrubbed it and it has this forever sticky film to it. Besides that it’s an amazing steamer and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: cheap and will not last
customer_reviews.text: this is a replacement for my last steamer which lasted 15 years before the container cracked. With this unit, the container is thin and it will not last one year. My mistake for buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry White

customer_reviews.title: Takes up a lot of space
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this steamer but it really just takes up too much space. It also is very difficult to clean especially if you are going to steam something fatty like meat or fish. Ended up returning it. I had bought it for baby food but I think I will stick to my baby food makers since they are more compact and easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Keep Looking
customer_reviews.text: Although this steamer comes with 2 bowls, the items placed in the top bowl do not satisfactorily cook because whatever is in the bottom bowl blocks the steam! The plastic bowls are very flimsy. I'm most unhappy about the fact there is no bell or buzzer to let you know when the timer has gone off. You have to constantly check the unit to see if it's done steaming and even then the timer dial is difficult to read, so you're not sure if there's still several minutes left! Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: I steam almost everything I eat. I have used a faberware steamer for years with great success, got a bit tired of having to wash the pan and the steamer. Decided to invest in this Oster steamer. I live alone have a small kitchen so small was my main criteria. I am kicking myself that I didn't buy it earlier. It performs so well. My only reservation is that the plastic baskets are a little flimsy, though they are much easier to wash than stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Norman S.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, Quality Product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The dual level steamer permits steaming two things at once or double the capacity for one item. The product is easy to use, put water in the bottom and set the time. Pretty self explanatory. I would recommend pot holders when removing the containers after steamed to avoid slightly burned fingers. Purchased in order to make Vegan type dishes.
customer_reviews.author: RMichael

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: It boiled my fish and turned it into a gelatinous mess. Supposed to just steam but after about 10minutes of cooking it was full of bubbles on the bottom tier. I couldn't eat the fish or the veggies. There's only one heat setting which I thought was way too high. Even wearing oven mitts, I was scalded by steam. plastic bins are flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: Received this steamer this morning and was excited to try it out. Honestly it is not great but not bad so I give it 3 stars. It is a little smaller than what I expected and the material is very flimsy. And it doesn't tell you whether it is BPA free or not. Steaming function is good and convenience. Cleaning is easy too so for the price I would say what get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap. Will break easily
customer_reviews.text: Did not care for this item. Very cheap material. If your cooking something on top the juice will pour off into the bottom rack. I would return but because it’s noy damaged I would have to pay for shipping which makes the return not worth it. Will give it away.
customer_reviews.author: luz carvalho

customer_reviews.title: Not much to say about
customer_reviews.text: I did not use so I can’t rate it, ended up returning. I found different one I liked more. It was smaller than I was expecting. The reason I gave 3 stars, when I tried to cancel 30min after I purchased , it did not let me to cancel and it delivered anyway , so I had to go and return. Very annoying...
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer. So far I've filled it with broccoli, cauliflower, asparagus, and bell peppers. Set it to 60 minutes, and everything inside is well steamed. Plastic is 'flimsy' as described by another review, but the pliability of the plastic in no way affects performance.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew James Flynn II

customer_reviews.title: Single Serving Steamer No Overflow Problems...
customer_reviews.text: Good little steamer for small meals for one person. To all of the people asking, "How do I keep the water reservoir from bubbling over?" I have licked that problem for you and am going to share it here. Fill up the reservoir to the halfway marker AT MOST. If you can get away with filling the reservoir a third of the way up, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bruiser's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Had to return my steamer.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this steamer. I followed instructions and used it 3 times - all 3 times it leaked water all over the kitchen counter tops. I don't know if I just got a defective item or what, but there is no drip pan like my old steamer had and it never leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess and gives a headache.
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and does an adequate job but it spills water all around it. I have to put it in a plate to catch spillage. OMG don't put top and bottom together without the separator ring 'cause you'll get a migraine trying to get them apart without breaking them.
customer_reviews.author: AtlantaGA

customer_reviews.title: It’s great but ...
customer_reviews.text: I really love my steamer. The only thing I can say that I don’t like too much is that a very small amount of water has to be added at a time or it flows into the first tray instead of steaming it , the water comes up and get all the food wet. The water doesn’t last too long and has to be refilled often while cooking one thing or it runs out and can ruin the steamer. Other than that, it works amazing and makes the healthiest meals in moments time.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Milu

customer_reviews.title: Works well, longevity concern
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this steamer. It is a good buy. My only concern is how flimsy the plastic is. I worry for the longevity of this product. I clean the food bins by hand because I am afraid the dishwasher could break it. One drop and it is over
customer_reviews.author: C_trureview

customer_reviews.title: Leakes badly from day one.
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived the box and packaging were in fine shape. I used it and it leaked all over the counter from the bottom. I thought it may have had to much water. I checked the fill line and not even close. I have tried it two more times and it leaks like crazy fen the bottom. Not happy. Now I have a bunch of useless plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Tlander

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my family
customer_reviews.text: We are a small family and the size is perfect, I steam my baby food with this steamer, I love that I can put everything inside I set the time and I get to do other things while is working then I come back and everything is ready to go
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Easy and works
customer_reviews.text: Cute little steamer. 1 tray will hold enough veggies for 3-4 people or 2 big people who like veggies a lot. Haven't tried both trays together yet, but don't doubt it'll work like the guide book says. Guide book has a bunch of cook times in it which is handy. Easy clean, easy set up, easy on/off.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: The other review was spot on. Not to big, not too small. Hard to find something smaller. This is great. It's not as well made as a previous one we had, but it will do. The size was the purchase factor and the price was fair.
customer_reviews.author: Dors

customer_reviews.title: Already broken
customer_reviews.text: I bought this steamer 4 months ago. It’s no longer working and Amazon says it’s “past the window to return it.” This is why it’s good to buy items actually at stores.
customer_reviews.author: James Glantz

customer_reviews.title: very small that I cannot put my smallest plate in
customer_reviews.text: with my previous steamer I was able to just put a small plate in, but with this one I cannot. it can thus be hard to clean if you steam chicken or other meat that the steamed blood may stick to the bottom of the steamer machine. One thing i like is that it should be quite safe because it will automatically stop functioning when there is not enough water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: First time I used it was a great experience! My salmon tasted delicious and it was healthy
customer_reviews.author: Annya

customer_reviews.title: Not going to buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in August 2016 and it is already not working. It will work for about 30 minutes and then quit. Will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Hope

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I don't disagree with some complaints about how light the bowls are. That is true. But, for the price and the results I am getting with this product, that's not a problem at all. This is easy to set up and use. Doesn't take too much room to store and provides accurate instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird

customer_reviews.title: Leaked all over the counter
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work. I loved the steamer but it leaked all over the counter! The only way to use it is to place a large folded towel underneath every time.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper Mom

customer_reviews.title: All and all not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: All past steamers had a drip pan - this does not and therefor the water is not circulated properly. The second tier is not done in time with the bottom one. It recommends not covering the holes - if this were done where would you put the food. All and all not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steamer
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Strong steam power. It only take a while for me to heat up and steam the buns I have at home. Haha. The only part could be better is that if it is made of stainless steel rather than plastic
customer_reviews.author: Jj

customer_reviews.title: Careful
customer_reviews.text: After the initial 5-star review in February, it was great then.....after about 2 months it began leaking water while steaming food. So far I have not been shocked electrically. I have to mop up the water on the counter after it is finished.
customer_reviews.author: Doodlebug1955

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy to receive this steamer however it came defective it leaks from the bottom. so I wasted my money So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: A little small but it's good to start off with steaming and then understand what you might need to upgrade to. Or good for a small condo or space.
customer_reviews.author: P. R. Kapoor

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 1 year
customer_reviews.text: This steamer worked well for the first year, then stopped working. It's a shame. We liked this little steamer, but if it can't hold up to occassional use beyond 1 year, it can't be recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Treevers

customer_reviews.title: Great gizmo!
customer_reviews.text: A must-have at home, especially, for small portion steaming. This is my third order. Although, I have a popular brand big steamer, I still keep this particular steamer handy for steaming veggies or food for one or two. Quality is good as it is dependable. This is why, I always purchase ahead of time, that is, before it looses its function to steam. I do use it practically every day.
customer_reviews.author: StAndre

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. Would not buy again. It tends ...
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Would not buy again. It tends to over bubble and spill everywhere while steaming. I either put too much water or too little water, even though I follow the max fill line. Still seems to over bubble and spill everywhere. I steamed beets once, came out delicious, but there was red water to clean up everywhere. :(
customer_reviews.author: Hi☺

customer_reviews.title: Performs Well, But Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Have used this steamer a few times and definitely steams vegetables well and evenly. The unit's plastic parts are very cheaply made and if you re not careful, the parts can break quite easily when washing them. That being said, as long as you are aware of the shortcomings, it's worth the 19 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for a great steamer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for a friend, she loves it! Cannot believe how good food tastes steamed. She has a real small kitchen and according to her this takes up little space.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, yet effective
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, throw in some fresh grub or protein, set the timer and Blam! Steamed veggies and protein all in one. Great buy, was a bit hesitant but happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kateri Killian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and everything I hoped it would be!
customer_reviews.text: This steamer is so easy to use and easy to clean. I cooked chicken in it (marinated and normally seasoned) and it tasted delicious. I like to bake chicken (never ate steamed chicken) and I was so surprised how much I loved the steamer chicken! The chicken was perfectly cooked and the veggies were so soft and yummy. I am in love with this steamer!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for another larger Oster steamer that stopped working. I'm surprised that they don't make the larger units anymore. This unit is smaller and the plastic is thin and it's pretty cheezy. The dial seems pretty flimsy as well. But that saying, it's pretty inexpensive. I don't expect it to last long but so far it does the job. It steams my veggies just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Erich S

customer_reviews.title: Don't know how I ever lived without it
customer_reviews.text: Awesome price, awesome quality, incredibly functional. I'd pay another $5 if they made the baskets from a thicker plastic. I always get nervous washing them, but after reasonably heavy use in the last year they haven't broken or cracked yet. One of my most used kitchen appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Allenson

customer_reviews.title: Food Steamer
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. Great price. I bought this because of the price because wanted to see if we were going to like using a steamer on our veggies. Very surprised. Easy cleaning, cooks perfect. Love it and still using it
customer_reviews.author: Marcella S.

customer_reviews.title: They truly love it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my in laws as they were both recovering from hospital stays and thought it would make things a little easier as well as allow them to keep their independence. It made things much easier for all of us that they were able to just put their food in the steamer all at once and a short time later their meal was ready. No worries about the oven being turned off and not a lot of mess to clean up afterwards. They truly love it.
customer_reviews.author: JLP

customer_reviews.title: Nice work
customer_reviews.text: Nice work cheap fast delivery ! I use it inside my truck
customer_reviews.author: Aslan

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Very nice 2 layers. 1 can be veg the bottom can be fish or other. 60 min timer.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Gutwerg

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Steamer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my mom. She loves it it's convenient and easy-to-use extremely healthy perfect works perfect .t definitely recommend to buy
customer_reviews.author: april

customer_reviews.title: It leaks....
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this steamer since December of last year and it already leaks out of the bottom of it. So 6 months worth of use is all we got out of it. I tried to ask amazon about a replacement or how to fix it since it hasn’t been a year and thier response was customer service is closed on this purchase. I have only hand washed it and I have kept the bottom dry but it still leaks bad.
customer_reviews.author: Brie Morris

customer_reviews.title: Inside
customer_reviews.text: As you can see from the pictures, the inside center part just fall off after a few months
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Cute and casual
customer_reviews.text: Cute! Perfect for one person especially if you’re not in a hurry. Timer goes up to one hour. Can steam frozen veggies and fish.
customer_reviews.author: Big Sur coast

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely in love with it. It took me a few tries to figure out the correct water levelfor different items but now I can't go a day without using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, steam quick
customer_reviews.text: I got this for cooking baby food. It has timer, just put water and food inside. Right now , I just steam pumpkin, sweet potato, carrots for him. After 6 months, I am ready cook egg and meat. More easy for me. And good price too.
customer_reviews.author: Bliss Drive

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly made not easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: A very cheaply designed and poorly manufactured item. The timer was DOA. Plastic everything which you could tell before buying but... as plastic goes again poorly manufactured. This item is not easy to clean, if you drop a container from counter height, it will have a pretty good chance of breaking. Hated it from day one but kept using it now I am throwing it not worth the return.
customer_reviews.author: nunzino pizza

customer_reviews.title: For fast healty meals, this is the device for you.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I've steamed salmon and veggies and they came out flawless. It's a simple device to use and operate.
customer_reviews.author: MUTT WONDERDUCK

customer_reviews.title: yum
customer_reviews.text: Makes cooking cauliflower and broccoli SO much easier. Just turn it on and you can forget about it till its done. Leaves wet on the counter but nothing dramatic just a little. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be healthy!
customer_reviews.text: A Facebook friend suggested this item, and after wanting one for a really long time, I decided to just get one. The price was VERY reasonable. The steamer is very easy to use and after a couple of times you'll get the hang of how long to set the timer for. I used the steamer daily, and eating fresh veggies (instead of canned or frozen) and fish. I have even cooked eggs in the shell (came out perfectly). This is one of the best purchases I've made through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: DEBBIE J MAPLES

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I love the steamer it works great and my food comes out with a great flavor it’s easy to clean and it’s very convenient since I can put different stuff in the tower and it will all be done at the same time. It wok grey with my healthy life style
customer_reviews.author: Winrock

customer_reviews.title: Make sure this small steamer is what you need, I had to buy a larger one after using this one for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Again, I used the photo instead of the size description to determine whether an item will be the size I need. This steamer works great but is too small to hold an artichoke or enough of the veggies my wife and I would eat in a single meal.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Cardinal

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this having used my friends. Disappointed!! Her’s was a flexible, rubbery like material that wouldn’t crack. Mine is a thin hard plastic that won’t stand up to much wear, easy to crack. Hers is older but exactly the same except for material it’s made from
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for everything
customer_reviews.text: My first test was squash and it came out perfect. Steamed some shrimp with some herbs and lemon and it was delicious. Easy to take apart and store without taking up much space, freeing up my counter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great but Plastic Chemical Warning
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it since December and it works great but when I was looking at the manual the other day an insert fell out stating that it has chemicals known to cause reproductive harm. Such a bummer. I had a fancy stainless steel Euro Steamer before but it is too complicated to use. I Guess I will try a glass steamer.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: I use this all the time. I not only steam vegetables, but also use it to reheat. Today I reheated chicken and rice. Came outmoded than it would have in the microwave. Very useful. Had an old one I used to death. Had to get a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Paramedic Zoom Zoom

customer_reviews.title: Excellent economical steamer.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent general purpose steamer. It appears to be identical to one I bought from Harbor Freight some rew years ago which worked well with very frequent use but I never found the source of a replacement heating element when that component burned out. Hopefully the Oster brand will stock parts. The plastic baskets appear to be a little fragile but held up well for me.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and gets the job done. Timer makes it easy to not over steam veggies . There are lots of fancier ones but this works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Diane Devore

customer_reviews.title: Steams Food, but Plastic is Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This product works. It steams vegetables quickly and efficiently. The clear plastic baskets are flimsy and would easily break if dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done/ good value
customer_reviews.text: This steamer is kind of cheaply made, kind of flimsy but so far it works just fine. It was priced well so I guess you get what you pay for. It washes well on the top rack of the dishwasher. I’ve steamed fish and vegetables and both turned out well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I Love that this works efficiently and quickly. Clean up is beyond easy! Food came out Great! I would recommend this to anyone and you cannot beat the price! Update.. I still use this 3-4 times week. Absolutely love this!! Makes eating vegetables so easy and i like chicken breast as well steamed. Can cook frozen..
customer_reviews.author: Keli Howd

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as older model I had.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a much older model that broke ( I dropped the lid and it broke in several pieces. My fault) I must say the quality has gone down a lot since my last one was made. It is MUCH smaller and the plastic baskets and lids are flimsy. I have a feeling this one won't last nearly as long as my old Oster Steamer. Is does steam well, and does the job for which it is intended.
customer_reviews.author: Doug M

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be handled gently.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Wonderful results .cleaning is a, breeze. Thin construction would like a little thicker plastic fear of breaking if dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works great. There is plenty of room in both layers ...
customer_reviews.text: So stoked on this! It works great. There is plenty of room in both layers for plenty of vegetables. I rarely use both at the same time. I wouldn't use it for artichokes. It takes way too long. You are better off boiling them.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Holy heck I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I use this steamer 5x a week. I find it's the perfect size for veggies, sweet potatoes etc. It usually only takes 15 mins for me to steam in both baskets. I love it! Frozen vegetables always turn out perfect as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Food boiler
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed at all....the bottom tray boils the food. Not steam, but boils.
customer_reviews.author: Heldupreadingabook

customer_reviews.title: very convenient
customer_reviews.text: We've only had this for a little while now, but we are very happy with our purchase. The Oster Steamer does exactly what it needs to do, it steams our vegetables, and is very convenient at that. Just pour some water in the bottom, fill the plastic containers with your choice of produce and turn the timer on. It does take longer to heat up than we expected, so we add an extra five minutes on the time now, easy peasy. It is easy to take apart and clean, easy to use and very light weight. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Anja

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised....
customer_reviews.text: Great product, works really well, I have used both single and stacked - great results both ways. I just wish the plastic containers were thicker plastic - quite thin.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I love that this steamer has a second level. It steams the food perfectly and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Donna DM Yates

customer_reviews.title: Rediscover flavors !!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 for my children for Christmas ! Their families use them 3-4 times per week and rediscovered the great taste of veggies 😊
customer_reviews.author: April Krause

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Simple and CHEAP! I purchased this to just TRY steaming electrically. It works great for all kinds of Veggies and fish. I've done carrots, potatoes, baby broccolli, brussel sprouts, string beans... I usually toss with spices (various, all work) salt, pepper and Olive oil. Check doneness with a fork and dinners ready.
customer_reviews.author: jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I only use one level so cant say if multi level would be good. Seems like it would be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Trace

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertized
customer_reviews.text: Seems to steam everything well but kind of hard to adjust timing. And it doesn't ding or buzz when finished. Hard to know when it's done. The double steaming works well but baskets are sort of small. My last steamer had a lot more room. Probably not great for a large family
customer_reviews.author: Janis

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Owner this steamer about a year, maybe more. While it works and does get the job done, the timer broke on it after about 9 months. If you forget to turn it off now it will just run... At least I don't think there is an auto shutoff. The plastic has also been cracking in the steamer trays and finally a piece of the cover broke off. It was small but luckily I noticed it and it didn't end up in any of my kid's foods.
customer_reviews.author: Bradly J

customer_reviews.title: Okay so this product is amazing however, there is one problem
customer_reviews.text: Okay so this product is amazing however, there is one problem. So when you steam, you put the water at the bottom. Now because the fish makes its own water, the water tends to flow over the side. So you have to watch it but other than that, it's amazing. You put your own seasoning, veggies and it has a timer. It's a great, affordable steamer to have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Love This!
customer_reviews.text: I love this steamer! It's very easy to use, it does a great job and the price is affordable. I steam my vegetables and this is perfect for steaming my broccoli, cauliflower, carrots, mushrooms, potatoes, corn, you name it. I wish I have found this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: D Reid

customer_reviews.title: Size saving steamer
customer_reviews.text: I love to steam my vegetables to save the nutrients. This is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Claire T Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of eating raw vegetables and this little steamer has made my tummy happy!! Super fast too!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Barkley

customer_reviews.title: this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly high quality for the price. If you need a small vegetable steamer, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

product_meta.title: Oster Double Tiered Food Steamer, 5 Quart, White (CKSTSTMD5-W-015)
product_meta.description: Make healthy, delicious meals quickly and easily with the Oster Double Tiered Food Steamer. This steamer cooks meat, fish, poultry, and vegetables with steam to retain nutrients while eliminating the need for calorie-rich cooking oils, sprays, and butter. Featuring a double-tiered design with two 5-quart bowls, the food steamer lets you simultaneously prepare up to two types of food separately. A 60-minute auto shut-off feature and a power indicator light make operating the steamer easy, while the dishwasher-safe components mean you can clean up in a snap. Ideal for smaller spaces, the food steamer's bowls nest for compact storage.
feature_bullets: Food steamer for vegetables, meat, fish, and poultry
Steaming retains nutrients and eliminates the need for cooking oils
Double-tiered design allows you to separate and simultaneously cook 2 types of food
Transparent steaming bowls let you see the progress
Steamer bowls nest for compact storage.Watts: 400W
Double-tiered 5-quart capacity steamer with two transparent steaming bowls
Auto shut-off when cycle is completed and/or water is empty

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
